item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Loveandpower:

I am 50/50 on gun laws to be honest. I mean in one sense, our forefathers fought so that we had this right. So that way we could keep our families safe and to keep a security at home.

on the other hand the second amendment can be read that the right of a well regulated militia (which the militia is required for a free state), the people of whom shall not be refused the right to bear arms

it’s worth noting that the second amendment says nothing about the right to bear arms for protection for family or homes, it’s the supreme court who says that

and on a third hand (radioactive waste, don’t ask) the second amendment says nothing about keeping nuclear arms either, can I get one fatman please?

item.title: Our Second Amendment Right
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

[quote=“m1lkman, post:12, topic:451464”][quote author=Jmood link=topic=554349.msg4060248#msg4060248 date=1343348621]

Why do you Americans mix up Switzerland and Sweden!?

In Switzerland every man goes to the army, and keep their weapons at home. This is a better idea for an army that I don’t many countries should adopt a similar version of.

THERE’S A DIFFERENCE??? :eek: [size=1pt]honest mistake, sorry[/size]

I like that idea. Send everyone into the army at some point in their life so they have the proper training and know how to handle a gun, then give them a gun to protect their country, their city, their neighborhood, and their home.

Ehhh, I don’t agree with sending everyone into the army. The army “brainwashes” you.

That can be said about anything… Oh this brainwashes you!
[/quote]

Yeah but on certain levels it does brainwash you, not to say it is a bad thing.[/quote]
Sometimes it can be a horrible thing though… It could even push some of them to kill others with the guns that they were trained to handle. Think about it. If you give people the power to kill another human being and many more and they snap, then all hell breaks loose. Even little things can snap inside the army veterans that cause them to go on a rampage.

item.title: Our Second Amendment Right
item.dc:creator: @gothic_queen casey.
item.description:
@gothic_queen wrote:

Using the most repetitive statement about gun control: Guns don’t kill people. People kill people.

Violence via guns is unstoppable. No matter what screenings or regulations are put into place, people will still be able to find ways around. Hell, I’m selling one of my old kayaks and I was offered a glock as a trade for it.

Rather than fund gun regulation, what needs to be done is fund more into finding out more about people with potential psychological problems who may present problems(example: James Holmes sent one of his counselors)-Now I’m not promoting the government go 1984 but allow some interaction to prevent these types of things from happening.

I’ll leave the rest to MITB.
